    • Method Detail

      • getAppData

        public AppResponse getAppData(Long accountId,
                     String appKey,
                     Boolean includeGameData,
                     String keyword,
                     Enums.GameLevelApiMap sortField,
                     Boolean descending,
                     Integer start,
                     Integer limit,
                     Boolean gameObjectCount,
                     Enums.Ownership filter,
                     Long dateCreated,
                     Long ownerId,
                     List<Long> missionIds,
                     List<Long> gameIds,
                     List<Long> packIds,
                     List<Long> gameLevelIds,
                     AppVersion appVersion,
                     Boolean includeHigherVersionPacks,
                     Boolean includeHigherVersionLevels,
                     List<Enums.ResponseGroup> responseGroups,
                     Enums.PurchaseType purchaseType)
                       throws SirqulException

        Get the application data structure. The basic structure is a node tree, with the root node being a AppResponse. The response contains the user's profile, messages from the system, and a list of MissionResponse. A mission can have any number of GameResponse's but typically is a single game type. A game then has any number of PackResponse's which help group the game levels. Packs are then composed of any number of GameLevelResponse's.

        Using the various parameters can return the applications default mission (built-in packs to play), the list of community levels published, the user's saved levels, or explicity levels desired. You can choose to include the profile or not, or just return parts of the profile. You can also filter out game levels that have been published with a higher version of the application.

        Target API Endpoint: /app/get

        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required).
        appKey - the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        includeGameData - if true then include the game data blob, otherwise don't include.
        keyword - keyword string used to filter the search results when looking for community and saved levels.
        sortField - how to sort the results when looking for community and saved levels. possible values are:
        LEVEL_NAME, LEVEL_CREATED, LEVEL_UPDATED, LEVEL_LIKES, LEVEL_DISLIKES, LEVEL_NOTES, LEVEL_PLAYS.
        descending - order the search results descending or ascending when looking for community and saved levels.
        start - start the search results at a record.
        limit - limit the search results to some number.
        gameObjectCount - if true then include the game object count, otherwise don't include.
        filter - restrict the search to items with certain permissions, possible values are:
        MINE, FRIENDS, PUBLIC, ALL_PUBLIC, ALL, LIKED
        dateCreated - restrict the search to items created less then date
        ownerId - get levels owned by a particular account
        missionIds - get missions by specified id, list of long ids
        gameIds - get games by specified id, list of long ids
        packIds - get packs by specified id, list of long ids
        gameLevelIds - get game levels by specified id, comman seperated list of long ids
        appVersion - the application version, used to versin the game level data
        includeHigherVersionPacks - default is false and will not include any packs that have levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        includeHigherVersionLevels - default is false and will not include any levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        responseGroups - use response groups to include large parts of the structure. possible values are:
        MISSION_DEFAULT (default) - include the default mission (built-in packs), excludes all other mission groups
        MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_SAVED - include saved levels, excludes all other mission groups
        MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_COMMUNITY - include community levels, excludes all other mission groups
        MISSION_INVITED (default) - include challenges sent to user
        PROFILE (default) - include entire profile
        PROFILE_DATA - only include profile date (exclude friends)
        PROFILE_FRIENDS - include friends list
        purchaseType - the will return the correct in app purchases for the device, possible values are:
        SIRQUL (default) - purchasing from the sirqul store using tickets
        IOS - purchasing from the itunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
        GOOGLE - purchasing from the google android store
        AMAZON - purchasing from the amazon android store
        MAC - purchasing from the itunes store for OSX
        FREE - the item is free to purchase
        Returns:
        a AppResponse containing the app data on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • regenerateAppData

        public SirqulResponse regenerateAppData(Long accountId)
                                 throws SirqulException
        Regenerate the app data cache for all apps

        Target API Endpoint: /app/regen.
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account ID of the user.
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with message of success or fail.
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • updateAppData

        public AppResponse updateAppData(Long accountId,
                        String appKey,
                        Boolean includeGameData,
                        String keyword,
                        Enums.GameLevelApiMap sortField,
                        Boolean descending,
                        Integer start,
                        Integer limit,

                        Enums.Ownership filter,
                        Long dateCreated,
                        Long ownerId,

                        List<Long> challengeIds,
                        List<Long> gameIds,
                        List<Long> packIds,
                        List<Long> gameLevelIds,
                        AppVersion appVersion,
                        Boolean includeHigherVersionPacks,
                        Boolean includeHigherVersionLevels,
                        List<Enums.ResponseGroup> responseGroups,
                        Enums.PurchaseType purchaseType,
                        String data)
                          throws SirqulException

        Publish the application data structure. Can be used to save levels and scores. It then returns the application data structure.

        The basic structure is a node tree, with the root node being a AppResponse. The response contains the user's profile, messages from the system, and a list of MissionResponse. A mission can have any number of GameResponses but typically is a single game type. A game then has any number of PackResponses which help group the game levels. Packs are then composed of any number of GameLevelResponse s.

        Using the various parameters can return the applications default mission (built-in packs to play), the list of community levels published, the user's saved levels, or explicity levels desired. You can choose to include the profile or not, or just return parts of the profile. You can also filter out game levels that have been published with a higher version of the application.

        Target API Endpoint: /app/post

        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required).
        appKey - the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        includeGameData - if true then include the game data blob, otherwise don't include.
        keyword - string used to filter the search results when looking for community and saved levels.
        sortField - how to sort the results when looking for community and saved levels. possible values are:
        LEVEL_NAME, LEVEL_CREATED, LEVEL_UPDATED, LEVEL_LIKES, LEVEL_DISLIKES, LEVEL_NOTES, LEVEL_PLAYS.
        descending - order the search results descending or ascending when looking for community and saved levels.
        start - the start index for pagination
        limit - the limit for pagination
        gameObjectCount - if true then include the game object count, otherwise don't include.
        filter - restrict the search to items with certain permissions, possible values are:
        MINE, FRIENDS, PUBLIC, ALL_PUBLIC, ALL, LIKED
        dateCreated - restrict the search to items created less then date
        ownerId - get levels owned by a particular account
        missionIds - get missions by specified id, list of long ids
        challengeIds - get challeneges by specified id, list of long ids
        gameIds - get games by specified id, list of long ids
        packIds - get packs by specified id, list of long ids
        gameLevelIds - get game levels by specified id, list of long ids
        appVersion - the application version, used to versin the game level data
        includeHigherVersionPacks - default is false and will not include any packs that have levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        includeHigherVersionLevels - default is false and will not include any levels above the specified appVersion. If true then will return all levels regardless of version.
        responseGroups - use response groups to include large parts of the structure. possible values are:
        MISSION_DEFAULT (default) - include the default mission (built-in packs), excludes all other mission groups
        MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_SAVED - include saved levels, excludes all other mission groups
        MISSION_DEFAULT_LEVELS_COMMUNITY - include community levels, excludes all other mission groups
        MISSION_INVITED (default) - include challenges sent to user
        PROFILE (default) - include entire profile
        PROFILE_DATA - only include profile date (exclude friends)
        PROFILE_FRIENDS - include friends list
        purchaseType - the will return the correct in app purchases for the device, possible values are:
        SIRQUL (default) - purchasing from the sirqul store using tickets
        IOS - purchasing from the itunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
        GOOGLE - purchasing from the google android store
        AMAZON - purchasing from the amazon android store
        MAC - purchasing from the itunes store for OSX
        FREE - the item is free to purchase
        data - an AppResponse object that includes just the data being saved, those nodes should be marked with an action of SAVE or DELETE
        Returns:
        a AppResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.
